title: kayle adc is stronger than ap/as kayle, working as intended
body:
you will deal just as much true damage by going 100% crit kayle (with guinso as non crit item for the AS ) than by going AP kayle. why that? beceause the true damage part can CRIT, and does 225 % true dmg with IE . so you end up having just as much true dmg on top of stronger auto attack. late game you will deal 160 true damage every auto attack with 2.4 AS, if taking lethal tempo you will get even more. it's the BEST DPS OPTION , and it's not like you lose anything of not having ap, beceause your Q ap scaling is bad. only things you lose is a little bit of damage from your ult. 

and i think this is TERRIBLE, i will abuse it for now but seriously, UP her ap ratio, remove the crit part of her true dmg. this should not be a things.

EDIT : the full build is {{item:3006}} {{item:3124}} {{item:3085}} {{item:3087}} {{item:3031}} {{item:3508}}   you can change the zeal item for example replace shyv with {{item:3094}} ,  anyway, i found no way to build that outdamage this build, and you deal 160 true dmg late game, with precisely 3.5 AS when lethal tempo is available, at 30 min with gathering storm and 1 fire drake you will have 400 AD with 100 crit for some nasty AD dmg, you will melt squishy in 3 aa max, melt tank in less than 3  sec, and still have 700/800 dmg on your ult for wombo combo engage. give me one reasons why i should build her ap :/

replies.body:
Because ad is op...

Why do you think everyone on the boards is like "ad champs have it better" 
Ad neeko was the most recent case of if you can be ad why be ap?
The reason that AD neeko works is because her AP base damage and movespeed steroid on her W is powerful and reduces the problem of a weak early allowing her to be strong in lane though......
And then instead of being a skill shot ap nuke champion she just transitioned into a safe (mostly) right click champion.

.....Well yeah, not that her skillshot deal was actually difficult either in lane given that she like lux aims to hit the root first, problem with her AP build was the ult being super unsafe to use since a literal glass cannon running into the enemy team is liable to die before even 1,5 seconds have passed. 

AD build works because it doesnt rely on her ult, just auto attacks and W movespeed&damage + the root to keep people in place while she hits them. 

Maybe ult at some points as marksmen in lane wont kill her quickly enough most of the time.

What was silly about her ultimate is that you could aa through the channel and cc someone as they were walking towards you to try and nuke you. 

Even if they turned around unless they had a huge dash they couldn’t run because they died too fast. 

Funny to watch not to play against.

Actually it's funny because Kayle used to build full AP with just Liche and one shot with Q and the Liche aa, which leaded into that playstyle being gutted for being too strong.

And then and for years until the rework Kayle was played on hit-ad and not full ap.

they can take away 15-18% penetration on Black cleaver and compensate it with 20-30 ad and make it melee only they can also take away 5% cdr and take away or add 5% from several other items and give them more raw stats. like IBG or {{item:3001}}  along with giving it 15 more magic resist and 200 more hp.

Its one of the best damage items it gives lots of defense you it helps with mana you dont you get hit you get mana back and all the other non mage classes do damage in small amounts with lots of procs except assassins. It gives mages sustain for spamming out their spells and the passive is capped so low but mages wont reach that cap much because they have large ass mana pools and cheap mana cost spells.

And "ad neeko" is just a slightly modified on hit build, hence why its almost always rageblade second with her w crazy high bases (they expected people to max it last) and will almost always include a nashors tooth.

So its not having anything to do with one stat being better, its just a playstyle shift that frankly shouldnt be present on a mage.
